Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: TUBING TYPE: This reference table describes the particular type of tubular or type.For example tubing, casing or liner. This is a general classification. A more specificdescription can be found in R_LINER_TYPE.
Column Comment.3: TUBING OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number identifying, in sequence, each changein pipe size.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the drilling pipe.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.8: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.9: COLLAR TYPE: The type of collar used to couple the tubular with another tubingstring.
Column Comment.10: COUPLING TYPE: A short length of pipe used to connect two joints of casing. Acasing coupling has internal threads (female threadform) machined to match theexternal threads (male threadform) of the long joints of casing. The two joints ofcasing are threaded into opposite ends of the casing coupling. Synonyms: casingcollar (Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary)
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: HOLE SIZE: Measurement of the diameter of the tubular hole.
Column Comment.15: HOLE SIZE OUOM: Hole size original unit of measure.
Column Comment.16: HUNG TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the drilling pipe.
Column Comment.17: HUNG TOP OUOM: Hung top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: INSIDE DIAMETER: Measurement of the inside diameter size of the tubularbore/pipe.
Column Comment.19: INSIDE DIAMETER OUOM: Inside diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: JOINT COUNT: Total number of joints in the string. A joint is a length of pipe, usuallyreferring to drillpipe, casing or tubing. While there are different standard lengths, themost common drillpipe joint length is around 30 ft [9 m]. For casing, the mostcommon length of a joint is 40 ft [12 m]. (schlumberger Oilfield Glossary).
Column Comment.21: LEFT IN HOLE LENGTH: the amount of casing left in the hole after pulling operationshave been performed, prior to plugging or remedial work.
Column Comment.22: LEFT IN HOLE LENGTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.23: LINER TYPE: This reference table describes the type of liner used in the borehole.For example, slotted, gravel packed or pre-perforated et c.
Column Comment.24: MANUIFACTURER: Unique identifier for the manufacturer of this equipment. Ideally,this information should be captured in the table CAT EQUIPMENT, making thiscolumn and other specificaiton columns redundant in this table.
Column Comment.25: MIXED STRING INDICATOR: A Y( es) or N(o) flag indicating the casing is a mixedstring. The length of the casing may be made up of joints with different tensilestrengths, or collapse resistance and yield strengths.
Column Comment.26: OBSERVATION DATE: Date the tubular observation occurred.
Column Comment.27: OUTSIDE DIAMETER: Measurement of the outside diameter size of the tubularbore/pipe.
Column Comment.28: OUTSIDE DIAMETER DESCRIPTION: Description of the outside diameter of thetubular/pipe (e.g., 9 5/8).
Column Comment.29: OUTSIDE DIAMETER OUOM: Outside diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.30: PACKER SET DEPTH: The depth the packer equipment was set to seal the casingor tubing.
Column Comment.31: PACKER SET DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.32: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.33: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.34: PULLED LENGTH: the length of the portion of casing that is pulled from a well bore,primarily during plugging operations or remedial work.
Column Comment.35: PULLED LENGTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.36: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.37: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional survey andmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.38: REPORTED BASE TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.39: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional survey andmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.40: REPORTED TOP TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.41: SEA FLOOR PENETRATION: the distance that the casing has penetrated below thesurface of the sea floor.
Column Comment.42: SEA FLOOR PENETRATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.43: SHOE DEPTH: Depth of the tubing shoe measured from the surface.
Column Comment.44: SHOE DEPTH OUOM: Shoe depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.45: STEEL SPECIFICATION: Manufacture"s specification under which the steel wasconstructed.
Column Comment.46: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.47: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.48: TORQUE: The torque applied to the joint between two components.
Column Comment.50: TUBING DENSITY: Density measurement (mass per unit lenght) of the tubular.
Column Comment.51: DENSITY OUOM: Tubular density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.52: TUBING GRADE: the tensile strength of the tubing material. A system of classifyingthe material specifications for steel alloys used in the manufacture of tubing.
Column Comment.53: STRENGTH: The axial load required to yield the pipe.
Column Comment.54: TUBING STRENGTH OUOM: Tubing strength original unit of measure.
Column Comment.55: TUBING WEIGHT: Weight measurement of the tubular
Column Comment.56: TUBING WEIGHT ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.57: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.58: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.59: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.60: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.61: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.62: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.63: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
